show_description:
notes at
http://xahlee.info/talk_show/xah_talk_show_2024-09-17.html

note, there is an error.
in the function directory-files-recursively, to skip dir name starting with a dot,
the proper predicate is
(lambda (x) (not (string-match-p "/\\." x)))
because the function is passed a subdirectory full path, not just name.

show_title: XahTV 2021-06-26, emacs lisp create hook, dark theme sucks
show_description:
• [Elisp: Create a Hook] ( http://ergoemacs.org/emacs/emacs_create_hook.html )

the problem of dark theme.
• dark theme is over rated.
• there is no automated way to create a dark theme from light theme. you actually have to design every color on a website or your app.
• even if you have the right colors, simply changing color set may effect your user interface userbility. For example, window border shadow.
• dark theme is actually more difficult to read.
• human eyes, actually read better, of black text on white background. because it is more natural, e.g. when you go outside in daylight. and they've done scientific test on this.
• just buy a great display. which has adjustable blue light filter .

• [User Interface Design] ( http://xahlee.info/js/web_design_index.html )

• [Web Design: Grey Text on White Background] ( http://xahlee.info/js/web_design_gray_on_white.html )

show_title: Wolfram Language Typesetting, TeX, Problems of Traditional Math Notation, Syntax and Proof Systems
show_description:
Links mentioned:
•  〈The TeX Pestilence (Why TeX/LaTeX Sucks)〉 [ http://xahlee.info/cmaci/notation/TeX_pestilence.html ]
•  〈The Problems of Traditional Math Notation〉 [ http://xahlee.info/cmaci/notation/trad_math_notation.html ]
• The design of notation or syntax is critical and non-trivial. They are deeply tied to foundation of math, proof theories, and theoretical computation. For example, formal languages, lambda calculus, combinators, they are all essentially string replacement systems.
• Formal languages also relates to parsers and regular expressions.
• Wikipedia Curry-Howard Isomorphism

show_title: xah talk show 2021-04-19 emacs lisp. explore ido and helm fuzzy match source code. part 2.
show_description:
We are going to explore the elisp source code of helm and ido mode, to see how they implement fuzzy matching.

First, we write a emacs command, that lets user choose from potentially thousands of academic phrases. Using ido mode's character based fuzzy matching. 10 minutes.
Helm uses a word based fuzzy matching, and order of words does not matter.
If our elisp exploration of helm source code is successful, we are going to modify our code to use helm's fuzzy matching.

Part one at:
http://xahlee.info/talk_show/xah_talk_show_2021-04-18.html
